instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN: What is EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN? EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN is necessary to enable the power rail that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.I2C_ALS_SDA: What is I2C_ALS_SDA? I2C_ALS_SDA is a SMBUS data line between the ambient light sensor and the T2 chip..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
good day guys, I hope all of you are well, please have got an issue with my <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , it does not display on the internal screen ,but displays fine on external monitor, I have swapped with a different screen cable, and screen but still no changes.

At <CHIP>U8510</CHIP>  
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> = 0.22
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>. ==3.3V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_DLY_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_TIEOFF</SIGNAL> = 3.3V


At J8500
pin 1 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> = 0V
pin 2 GND
PIN 3 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_P</SIGNAL> = 0V
PIN 4 <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> = 0.22
PIN 5 GND
PIN 6 <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> = 0V
PIN 7 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL> = 0V
PIN 8 GND
PIN 9 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL> = 0V
PIN 10 <SIGNAL>TP_LCD_IRQ_L</SIGNAL> = 0.019
PIN 11& 12 GND
PIN 13 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL> = 0.125
PIN 14 UNCONNECTED
PIN 15 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL> = 0.01
PIN 16 <SIGNAL>BKLT_PWM_MLB2TCON</SIGNAL> = 0V
PIN 17/18 GND
PIN 19 <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL> = 0.1V
PIN 28 AND 30 <SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SDA</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
PIN 34 <SIGNAL>I2C_ALS_SDA</SIGNAL> = 1.8V
PIN 44 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
PIN 45 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> = 5V
since I did not  get 3.3V at <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> I  replaced <CHIP>U8510</CHIP> but no changes 
please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at  <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> .
Be sure to have good solders at <CHIP>U8510</CHIP>.
Also check pin 12 voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message: diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> is OL and pin 12 is 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message: You should get some reading, if connect RED probe to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message: I have checked it several times again but still nothing, with red probe on ground, I get OL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
Maybe bad solders at <CHIP>U8510</CHIP>?
Try another chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message: I have re-soldered <CHIP>U8510</CHIP> , but still get OL, I tried to also measure when the chip was off the board , and I still get OL, I will try another chip , one quick question, must it be from the same exact board even though <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> uses the same ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
It should work from other board, if is the same chip.
Check diode mode on other board, at same pin.
